RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">RSA Quick Look Webcast: http://www.rsaconference.com/media/quick-look-proactive-counterespionage-as-a-part-of-business-continuity-and-resiliency

This white paper corresponds to the RSA Presentation entitled: &quot;Proactive Counterespionage as a Part of Business Continuity and Resiliency&quot;
Presentation Abstract: The session will discuss means in which information assets and business continuity is protected and propose an additional layer of defense with a human counterespionage focus. The proposed proactive counterespionage plan includes operational security audits, reverse open source intelligence and classification of employees who are prime targets for disruptive espionage. - See more at: http://www.rsaconference.com/events/ad15/agenda/sessions/2219/proactive-counterespionage-as-a-part-of-business#sthash.DTYlHe6a.dpuf</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rlmai7d6:" FRAMEWORK</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save COMMON GOOD DIGITAL FRAMEWORK for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mm6ai7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mm6ai7d6:" class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mm6ai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mm6ai7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/bostonglobalforum">Boston Global Forum</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The Common Good Digital Framework (CGDF) is a proposed campaign and platform to monitor violations of ethical values and standards related to artificial intelligence, personal data, cyber security, and digital activity by governments and large organizations. The CGDF will focus on issues like AI bias, privacy, and cyber security, and will generate policy recommendations in response to identified problems. It will utilize partners, advisors, and social media to distribute its findings and recommendations in order to influence policymaking and encourage corrective actions. The goal is to establish new ethical norms and regulations to help guide digital progress for the benefit of all humanity.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rm6ai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rm6ai7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document discusses the evolution of misinformation and proposes a framework called AMITT (Attribution, Mitigation, Incident and Technique Taxonomy) to analyze misinformation campaigns and incidents. It suggests populating the AMITT framework by cataloging historical misinformation examples. Finally, it notes that further work is needed to develop mitigations and counters, refine techniques, and share intelligence using the framework.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rmmai7d6:" science. The intent of this document is to set in motion the discussion for the creation of a startup in South Africa that is focused on data science.  </span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rn6ai7d6:" Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save SOCRadar-Australia-Threat Landscape-Report-2024.pdf for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mnmai7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mnmai7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mnmai7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/socradar">SOCRadar</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The 2024 Australia Threat Landscape Report by SOCRadar dives into the evolving cyber threats impacting Australia&#x27;s key industries, focusing on ransomware, phishing, and Dark Web activities. Key findings include:

Ransomware Surge: A substantial increase in ransomware incidents, especially from groups like Medusa, LockBit 3.0, and Akira, targeting sectors such as retail and healthcare.
Dark Web Exposure: Australian organizations are heavily featured in Dark Web data sales, with notable activity against the retail and finance sectors.
Phishing and DDoS Attacks: The rise in phishing attacks and record-breaking DDoS incidents underscores the sophistication of current cyber threats.
The report offers strategic recommendations for organizations to enhance cybersecurity resilience, leveraging SOCRadar’s Extended Threat Intelligence, which includes tools for proactive threat detection, Dark Web monitoring, and brand protection.

Get insights from the full report to safeguard your assets and strengthen cyber defenses in Australia’s challenging digital landscape.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rnmai7d6:" popover="auto" class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/cgarcia045">Cristian Garcia G.</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document summarizes John Kindervag&#x27;s report &quot;No More Chewy Centers: The Zero Trust Model Of Information Security&quot;. The report argues that traditional perimeter-based network security models are ineffective against modern threats like targeted attacks and malicious insiders. It introduces the &quot;Zero Trust&quot; model, which considers all network traffic untrusted and requires strict access controls and monitoring. The report recommends security professionals adopt this new model to better protect their organizations from sophisticated adversaries inside and outside the network.</span></div></div><div class="" class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mpmai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mpmai7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/mok">Charles Mok</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document discusses emerging security issues related to fake news, AI, and privacy. It summarizes recent regulations on facial recognition in the US, UK, and EU. It also discusses misinformation campaigns related to protests in Hong Kong and how Twitter and Facebook have taken actions to suspend accounts spreading misinformation. The document explores how misinformation can be spread through deepfake videos and AI-generated fake news. It discusses efforts to combat fake news through fact checking and provides examples from Hong Kong and Taiwan. Finally, it calls for the IT industry to adopt an approach that puts people first, develops privacy-enabled technologies, and promotes openness and public awareness.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rpmai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rpmai7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/Qrator_Labs">Qrator Labs</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This report contains the main corporate site availability and security trends and issues of 2015 related to DDoS and “hacking” threats. It is prepared by Qrator Labs and Wallarm specialists and based on industry situation monitoring (in Russia and worldwide), and on statistics collected from their customers in 2015. In addition, this report includes data from independent company research conducted on behalf of Qrator Labs.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rq6ai7d6:" popover="auto" slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">State of Endpoint Security: The Buyers Mindset</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save State of Endpoint Security: The Buyers Mindset for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mgmbi7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mgmbi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mgmbi7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mgmbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mgmbi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Where is endpoint security headed? How do your priorities and capabilities compare to those of your peers?

As the battle against breaches rages on, many enterprises are focused on revamping their endpoint security strategy – from enhancing efficacy to reducing complexity and agent bloat. A new webcast, “State of the Endpoint: The Buyer Mindset,” discusses the current state of endpoint security and offers insights from an all-star panel of thought leaders, including Internationally recognized cybersecurity leader and CrowdStrike Co-founder Dmitri Alperovitch, VP of Product Marketing Dan Larson, and other experts as they discuss today’s most important security issues. Join them as they explore the findings from a new research report, “Trends in Endpoint Security: A State of Constant Change,” a study conducted by ESG and commissioned by CrowdStrike and other technology vendors. The panel will provide their impressions of the data in the survey and how the viewpoints revealed mesh with current technology trends, offering insights that can help inform your security strategy going forward.

Join this webcast to learn:

-The current state of Antivirus (AV) including how many organizations are choosing to change vendors and why
-Best of breed vs. comprehensive suites – which approach do your peers prefer and what are the advantages and challenges of each?
-How solutions are affecting endpoints and your IT Security peers, including the increase in agents installed and the impact of increased complexity</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rgmbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rgmbi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-1" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rh6bi7d6:" popovertarget=":Rh6bi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rh6bi7d6"><a Stop Them</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:1" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="Understanding Fileless (or Non-Malware) Attacks and How to Stop Them" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/crowdstrikefilelesscrowdcastss-170725183300-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Understanding Fileless (or Non-Malware) Attacks and How to Stop Them</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Understanding Fileless (or Non-Malware) Attacks and How to Stop Them for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mh6bi7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mh6bi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mh6bi7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mh6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mh6bi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">How adversaries use fileless attacks to evade your security and what you can do about it

Standard security solutions have continued to improve in their ability to detect and block malware and cyberattacks. This has forced cybercriminals to employ stealthier methods of evading legacy security to achieve success, including launching fileless attacks, where no executable file is written to disk. Download this presentation provided by CrowdStrike security experts to learn why so many of today’s adversaries are abandoning yesterday’s malware and relying on an evolving array of fileless exploits. 

You’ll learn how fileless attacks are conceived and executed and why they are successfully evading the standard security measures employed by most organizations. You’ll also receive guidance on the best practices for defending your organization against these stealthy, damaging attacks.

The following presentation includes:
--How a fileless attack is executed — see how an end-to-end attack unfolds
--Why fileless attacks are having so much success evading legacy security solutions
--How you can protect your organization from being victimized by a fileless attack, including the security technologies and policies that are most effective</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rh6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rh6bi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" Defending Against Digital Shakedowns </span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mhmbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mhmbi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Real world lessons from CrowdStrike Services experts investigating complex cyber extortion attacks

The criminal act of theft is as old as civilization itself, but in the cyber realm new ways to steal your organization&#x27;s data or profit by holding it hostage, continue to evolve. With each advancement in security technology, adversaries work tirelessly on new techniques to bypass your defenses. This webcast, &quot;Cyber Extortion: Digital Shakedowns and How to Stop Them&quot; examines the evolution of cyber extortion techniques, including the latest &quot;datanapping&quot; exploits. Whether it&#x27;s an attack on a major movie studio, a massive healthcare system, or a global entertainment platform, recent extortion attempts demonstrate how critical it is to understand today&#x27;s threat landscape so you can ensure that your organization mounts the best defense possible.

Download this presentation to learn what security experts from the cyber defense frontlines are discussing. Learn about:

•The range of extortion techniques being used today, including commonalities and differences in approaches
•Commodity type ransomware/datanapping vs. hands-on attacks — how are they alike and what are their differences?
•Potential outcomes of paying vs. not paying when attempting to recover data after an attack
•Real world examples of successful attacks and those that were thwarted or mitigated
•Strategies for keeping your organization from being targeted and what to do if you become the victim of a cyber shakedown</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rhmbi7d6:" popover="auto" RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Gain in-depth information on the massive WannaCry ransomware attack

On Friday, May 12, the WannaCry ransomware variant swept the globe. In a short period of time, WannaCry (also known as Wanna Decryptor and WannaCryptor) infected over 230,000 systems in 150 countries. It was a particularly effective piece of malware because it not only encrypted data and held it for ransom, but it also spread like wildfire to other systems. Entire organizations found themselves looking at a ransom note on their screens and wondering what to do next.

As the situation continues to unfold, please join us as Adam Myers, VP of Threat Intelligence at CrowdStrike, presents an in-depth look at the WannaCry ransomware.

Register for this webcast to learn:
-A complete technical understanding of the WannaCry threat
-What analysts were seeing on the day of the WannaCry outbreak
-How to prevent WannaCry infections and protect against ransomware going forward</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Ri6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" OverWatch Experts Hunt 24/7 To Stop Incidents Before They Become Breaches

Is your IT security team suffering from alert fatigue? For many organizations, chasing down every security alert can tax an already overburdened IT department, often resulting in a breach that might have been avoided. Adding to this challenge is an increase in sophisticated threats that strike so fast and frequently, traditional methods of investigation and response can’t offer adequate protection. 

A new webcast from CrowdStrike, “Proactive Threat Hunting: Game-Changing Endpoint Protection Above and Beyond Alerting,” discusses why so many organizations are vulnerable to unseen threats and alert fatigue, and why having an approach that is both reactive and proactive is key. You’ll also learn about Falcon OverWatch™, CrowdStrike’s proactive threat hunting service that investigates and responds to threats immediately, dramatically increasing your ability to react before a damaging breach occurs.

Download the webcast slides to learn:

--How constantly reacting to alerts prevents you from getting ahead of the potentially damaging threats designed to bypass standard endpoint security
--Why an approach that includes  proactive threat hunting, sometimes called Managed Detection and Response, is key to increasing protection against new and advanced threats   
--How CrowdStrike Falcon OverWatch can provide 24/7 managed threat hunting, augmenting your security efforts with a team of cyber intrusion detection analysts and investigators who proactively identify and prioritize incidents before they become damaging breaches

If your organization has moved to a Mac-based platform, or are considering it, you may be aware that threats targeting Mac devices are on the rise. A new webcast from CrowdStrike, &quot;Defending Against Threats Targeting the Mac Platform&quot; discusses how the increase in Mac adoptions has given rise to a new class of targeted threats and explains why standard security solutions can&#x27;t protect you.

In this CrowdCast, Peter Ingebrigtsen, as discussed why more companies are switching to the Mac platform, the new threats targeting Macs, and what you can do to better protect your organization.

prevent &amp; detect even the most complex “file-less” ransomware exploits

Ransomware continues to evolve as perpetrators develop new exploits with consequences that can be dramatic and immediate. The purveyors of ransomware continue to prosper with adversaries developing new strains such as Zepto and Cerber that are proving to be more challenging than ever. Other exploits can alter programmable logic controller (PLC) parameters and adversely impact mechanical systems. Clearly, new defense approaches are needed because organizations can no longer rely on backups and conventional security solutions to protect them. Join CrowdStrike Senior Security Architect Dan Brown as he offers details on these sophisticated new ransomware threats, and reveals recent innovations designed to offer better protection – including new indicator of attack (IOA) behavioral analysis methodologies that can detect and prevent even the most complex “file-less” ransomware exploits.

Attend this CrowdCast where Dan will discuss:
--The challenges of defending against dangerous new variants, such as Zepto and Cerber
--Real-world examples of ransomware in action and the sophisticated tactics being used by a variety of adversaries
--How the CrowdStrike Falcon cloud-delivered platform can defend your organization against new super strains of ransomware that use sophisticated malware-free tactics

RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document summarizes CrowdStrike&#x27;s endpoint security product Falcon and argues that it provides more effective protection than legacy antivirus solutions. It notes that antivirus has an efficacy rate of only 45% against modern threats and is ineffective at stopping sophisticated attacks. CrowdStrike&#x27;s Falcon uses techniques like machine learning, IOAs, and threat intelligence to prevent a wider range of attacks while having a smaller system footprint than antivirus. It also provides detection capabilities like endpoint detection and response to eliminate attack dwell time. The document aims to convince readers to replace their legacy antivirus with CrowdStrike&#x27;s Falcon.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rk6bi7d6:" popover="auto" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/futureofendpointsecuritycc-170221194042-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/futureofendpointsecuritycc-170221194042-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Cloud-Enabled: The Future of Endpoint Security</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Cloud-Enabled: The Future of Endpoint Security for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mkmbi7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mkmbi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mkmbi7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mkmbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mkmbi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">As the cost and complexity of deploying and maintaining on-premises security continues to rise, many endpoint security providers have embraced the cloud as the ideal way to deliver their solutions. Yet, incorporating cloud services into legacy architectures limits their ability to fully engage the tremendous power the cloud offers.

CrowdStrike Falcon recognized the value of cloud-delivery from the beginning, developing architecture built from the ground up to take full advantage of the cloud. CrowdStrike’s cloud-powered endpoint security not only ensures rapid deployment and infinite scalability, it increases your security posture by enabling real-time advanced threat protection across even the largest, distributed enterprises.

In this CrowdCast, Jackie Castelli, Sr. Product Manager will discuss:

•The advantages of endpoint protection purpose-built for the cloud – why it allows you to take full advantage of the cloud’s power
•The common concerns organizations face when evaluating cloud-based endpoint security - can privacy and control be assured?
•Real-world examples demonstrating the unique advantages    offered by CrowdStrike Falcon’s innovative cloud-powered platform</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rkmbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rkmbi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-9" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rl6bi7d6:" popovertarget=":Rl6bi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rl6bi7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/you-cant-stop-the-breach-without-prevention-and-detection/67472196"><span class="sr-only">You Can&#x27;t Stop The Breach Without Prevention And Detection</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:9" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="You Can&#x27;t Stop The Breach Without Prevention And Detection" slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">You Can&#x27;t Stop The Breach Without Prevention And Detection</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save You Can&#x27;t Stop The Breach Without Prevention And Detection for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5ml6bi7d6:" popovertarget=":R5ml6bi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5ml6bi7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5ml6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5ml6bi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document discusses the need for a balanced approach to endpoint security that includes both prevention and detection. It argues that relying solely on prevention is not sufficient, as attacks will always get through, requiring detection capabilities to identify breaches. Likewise, detection alone is insufficient, as preventing attacks upfront reduces workload. The document outlines the key components needed to properly unify next-generation antivirus and endpoint detection and response, including complete visibility of endpoint activity, large-scale analysis capacity, and the ability to derive insights and indicators of attack from collected data. An integrated approach is advocated that allows prevention and detection to strengthen one another.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rl6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rl6bi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-10" aria-haspopup="dialog" Machine Learning </span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mlmbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mlmbi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document discusses how machine learning can be used to battle unknown malware. It provides examples of using machine learning techniques like feature selection, dimensionality reduction, and classification on military personnel data and malware samples. While machine learning is effective against most malware, it is not enough on its own as many attacks do not use malware. A comprehensive prevention approach is needed to address the full spectrum of threats.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rlmbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rlmbi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-11" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rm6bi7d6:" popovertarget=":Rm6bi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rm6bi7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike/java-journal-pyresso-a-pythonbased-framework-for-debugging-java"><span class="sr-only">Java Journal &amp; Pyresso: A Python-Based Framework for Debugging Java</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:11" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="Java Journal &amp; Pyresso: A Python-Based Framework for Debugging Java" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/javajournalpyspresso-160624232225-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Java Journal &amp; Pyresso: A Python-Based Framework for Debugging Java</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Java Journal &amp; Pyresso: A Python-Based Framework for Debugging Java for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mm6bi7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mm6bi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mm6bi7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mm6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mm6bi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Despite the multitude of Java decompilers available, we often have the need to debug or trace malicious or obfuscated Java bytecode. Existing Java debuggers and tracers are mostly targeted towards Java developers, are closed-source, and are not meant to handle malicious or obfuscated targets. We present a new open-source cross-platform framework for debugging Java, written completely in Python, designed specifically for reverse engineering. We also present a Java method call tracer as a sample Python application that utilizes this framework.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rm6bi7d6:" popover="auto" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-14" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rnmbi7d6:" popovertarget=":Rnmbi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rnmbi7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-cast-monthly-mitigating-pass-the-hash/26618483"><span class="sr-only">CrowdCasts Monthly: Mitigating Pass the Hash</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:14" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">CrowdCasts Monthly: Mitigating Pass the Hash</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save CrowdCasts Monthly: Mitigating Pass the Hash for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mnmbi7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mnmbi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mnmbi7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mnmbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mnmbi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Sixteen years later and Pass the Hash (PtH) is still one of the most common techniques a targeted attacker can use to compromise a network. There have been many blogs, webinars, and papers covering different PtH mitigation strategies. With all the information about this particular security vulnerability, networks are still continuously attacked and infiltrated using this technique. It is time to look at the problem from a holistic approach and apply the communities&#x27; collective intelligence to make this process one of the most difficult for a targeted attacker to use. </span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rnmbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rnmbi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-15" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Ro6bi7d6:" popovertarget=":Ro6bi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Ro6bi7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/endtoend-analysis-of-a-domain-generating/25244628"><span class="sr-only">End-to-End Analysis of a Domain Generating Algorithm Malware Family</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:15" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="End-to-End Analysis of a Domain Generating Algorithm Malware Family" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/end-to-endanalysisofadomaingeneratingalgorithmmalwarefamily-slides-130814103104-phpapp02-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="End-to-End Analysis of a Domain Generating Algorithm Malware Family" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/end-to-endanalysisofadomaingeneratingalgorithmmalwarefamily-slides-130814103104-phpapp02-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">End-to-End Analysis of a Domain Generating Algorithm Malware Family</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save End-to-End Analysis of a Domain Generating Algorithm Malware Family for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mo6bi7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mo6bi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mo6bi7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mo6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mo6bi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document summarizes the analysis of a domain generating algorithm (DGA) malware family. Key points include:

- The malware uses inline code obfuscation and encrypted strings to hide its functionality and communication domains. Researchers were able to deobfuscate the code and decrypt the strings to analyze the malware. 

- Clues in decrypted strings suggest the malware author is Romani, including references to Romani singers in template strings. 

- The malware generates domain names by concatenating two randomly selected words from a dictionary and appending &quot;.net&quot;. This allows it to generate many domain variations to communicate with its command and control servers.

- The DGA algorithm uses a 15-bit seed value derived from the</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Ro6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Ro6bi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-16" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rombi7d6:" popovertarget=":Rombi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rombi7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/tor-all-the-things/25244568"><span class="sr-only">TOR... ALL THE THINGS</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:16" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="TOR... ALL THE THINGS" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/tor-130814102922-phpapp02-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="TOR... ALL THE THINGS" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/tor-130814102922-phpapp02-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">TOR... ALL THE THINGS</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save TOR... ALL THE THINGS for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mombi7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mombi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mombi7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mombi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mombi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The global Tor network and its routing protocols provide an excellent framework for online anonymity. However, the selection of Tor-friendly software for Windows is sub-par at best. 

Want to anonymously browse the web? You’re stuck with Firefox, and don’t even think about trying to anonymously use Flash. Want to dynamically analyze malware without letting the C2 server know your home IP address? You’re outta luck. Want to anonymously use any program that doesn’t natively support SOCKS or HTTP proxying? Not gonna happen. 

While some solutions currently exist for generically rerouting traffic through Tor, these solutions either don’t support Windows, or can be circumvented by malware, or require an additional network gateway device. 

Missed the live session at Black Hat USA 2013? Check out the slides from Jason Geffner&#x27;s standing room only presentation! Jason released a free new CrowdStrike community tool to securely, anonymously, and transparently route all TCP/IP and DNS traffic through Tor, regardless of the client software, and without relying on VPNs or additional hardware or virtual machines.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rombi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rombi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-17" aria-haspopup="dialog" Malware Family Whitepaper</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:17" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mp6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mp6bi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document provides an overview of domain generating algorithms (DGAs) used by malware to dynamically determine remote server addresses and evade detection. It details the analysis performed on a malware family submitted to CrowdStrike, including deobfuscating the binary, analyzing its DGA and network functionality, sinkholing domains, and investigating the malware author. The family has been active for at least six years and infects thousands of devices.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rp6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rp6bi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-18" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rpmbi7d6:" popovertarget=":Rpmbi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rpmbi7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/tor-all-the-things-whitepaper/25207431"><span class="sr-only">TOR... ALL THE THINGS Whitepaper</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:18" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="TOR... ALL THE THINGS Whitepaper</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save TOR... ALL THE THINGS Whitepaper for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mpmbi7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mpmbi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mpmbi7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mpmbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mpmbi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document introduces Tortilla, software designed to allow security researchers to safely and anonymously interact with hostile servers and actors online. It discusses how traditional malware research was more passive, but now requires actively monitoring adversary infrastructure. The Tor network and Tor Browser Bundle are described as existing solutions for anonymity, but they have limitations like only supporting the Firefox browser and not plugins. Tortilla aims to address these issues by providing a more robust anonymity solution.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rpmbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rpmbi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div Presence of Bootkits</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:19" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img Regaining Control of Your Disk in the Presence of Bootkits for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mq6bi7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mq6bi7d6:" class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mq6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mq6bi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document discusses a technique for regaining control of a disk in the presence of a bootkit by leveraging the crash dump stack in Windows. It provides background on the crash dump stack and how it differs from the normal I/O path. It then describes how identifying and calling the crash dump port and miniport drivers allows sending I/O requests outside of the normal path to bypass bootkit filters and read/write directly to disk. The document concludes with an overview of how this technique can be demonstrated against the TDL4 bootkit.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rq6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rq6bi7d6"></div></div><div class="desktop-recs"><div class="Slider_root__c0Jo8"><div class="Slider_scroller__KHjw4"><div Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Boosting MySQL with Vector Search -THE VECTOR SEARCH CONFERENCE 2025 .pdf for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mk6ci7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mk6ci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mk6ci7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mk6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mk6ci7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/askdba">Alkin Tezuysal</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">As the demand for vector databases and Generative AI continues to rise, integrating vector storage and search capabilities into traditional databases has become increasingly important. This session introduces the *MyVector Plugin*, a project that brings native vector storage and similarity search to MySQL. Unlike PostgreSQL, which offers interfaces for adding new data types and index methods, MySQL lacks such extensibility. However, by utilizing MySQL&#x27;s server component plugin and UDF, the *MyVector Plugin* successfully adds a fully functional vector search feature within the existing MySQL + InnoDB infrastructure, eliminating the need for a separate vector database. The session explains the technical aspects of integrating vector support into MySQL, the challenges posed by its architecture, and real-world use cases that showcase the advantages of combining vector search with MySQL&#x27;s robust features. Attendees will leave with practical insights on how to add vector search capabilities to their MySQL systems.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rk6ci7d6:" popover="auto" In this session you will learn how to manage a production ready AWS account capable of scaling as your startup grows for less than $100/month before credits. Future-How AI-powered Accessibility Testing is Shaping...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:11" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/creatinganaccessiblefuture-howai-poweredaccessibilitytestingisshapingdigitalinclusion-250605094224-ec55ee96-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="Creating an Accessible Future-How AI-powered Accessibility Testing is Shaping..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/creatinganaccessiblefuture-howai-poweredaccessibilitytestingisshapingdigitalinclusion-250605094224-ec55ee96-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Creating an Accessible Future-How AI-powered Accessibility Testing is Shaping...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Creating an Accessible Future-How AI-powered Accessibility Testing is Shaping... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mm6ci7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mm6ci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mm6ci7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mm6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mm6ci7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/ipublishcentral">Impelsys Inc.</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Web accessibility is a fundamental principle that strives to make the internet inclusive for all. According to the World Health Organization, over a billion people worldwide live with some form of disability. These individuals face significant challenges when navigating the digital landscape, making the quest for accessible web content more critical than ever.

Enter Artificial Intelligence (AI), a technological marvel with the potential to reshape the way we approach web accessibility. AI offers innovative solutions that can automate processes, enhance user experiences, and ultimately revolutionize web accessibility. In this blog post, we’ll explore how AI is making waves in the world of web accessibility.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rm6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rm6ci7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-12" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rmmci7d6:" popovertarget=":Rmmci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rmmci7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/pdf-net_nationalfuelstreatmentsinitiative_wwilson_20250507-will-wilson_compressed-1-pdf/280421769"><span class="sr-only">National Fuels Treatments Initiative: Building a Seamless Map of Hazardous Fu...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:12" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="National Fuels Treatments Initiative: Building a Seamless Map of Hazardous Fu..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/pdf-250610181133-26e3b12c-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="National Fuels Treatments Initiative: Building a Seamless Map of Hazardous Fu..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/pdf-250610181133-26e3b12c-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">National Fuels Treatments Initiative: Building a Seamless Map of Hazardous Fu...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save National Fuels Treatments Initiative: Building a Seamless Map of Hazardous Fu... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mmmci7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mmmci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mmmci7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mmmci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mmmci7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/SafeSoftware">Safe Software</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The National Fuels Treatments Initiative (NFT) is transforming wildfire mitigation by creating a standardized map of nationwide fuels treatment locations across all land ownerships in the United States. While existing state and federal systems capture this data in diverse formats, NFT bridges these gaps, delivering the first truly integrated national view. This dataset will be used to measure the implementation of the National Cohesive Wildland Strategy and demonstrate the positive impact of collective investments in hazardous fuels reduction nationwide. In Phase 1, we developed an ETL pipeline template in FME Form, leveraging a schema-agnostic workflow with dynamic feature handling intended for fast roll-out and light maintenance. This was key as the initiative scaled from a few to over fifty contributors nationwide. By directly pulling from agency data stores, oftentimes ArcGIS Feature Services, NFT preserves existing structures, minimizing preparation needs. External mapping tables ensure consistent attribute and domain alignment, while robust change detection processes keep data current and actionable. Now in Phase 2, we’re migrating pipelines to FME Flow to take advantage of advanced scheduling, monitoring dashboards, and automated notifications to streamline operations. Join us to explore how this initiative exemplifies the power of technology, blending FME, ArcGIS Online, and AWS to solve a national business problem with a scalable, automated solution.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rmmci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rmmci7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-13" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rn6ci7d6:" popovertarget=":Rn6ci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rn6ci7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/ben-blair-operating-safely-in-a-vibe-coding-world/280238766"><span class="sr-only">Ben Blair - Operating Safely in a Vibe Coding World</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:13" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="Ben Blair - Operating Safely in a Vibe Coding World</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rn6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rn6ci7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-14" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rnmci7d6:" popovertarget=":Rnmci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rnmci7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/trends-artificial-intelligence-mary-meeker/280201724"><span class="sr-only">Trends Artificial Intelligence - Mary Meeker</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Trends Artificial Intelligence - Mary Meeker for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mnmci7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mnmci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mnmci7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mnmci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mnmci7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CliveDickens">Clive Dickens</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Mary Meeker’s 2024 AI report highlights a seismic shift in productivity, creativity, and business value driven by generative AI. She charts the rapid adoption of tools like ChatGPT and Midjourney, likening today’s moment to the dawn of the internet. The report emphasizes AI’s impact on knowledge work, software development, and personalized services—while also cautioning about data quality, ethical use, and the human-AI partnership. In short, Meeker sees AI as a transformative force accelerating innovation and redefining how we live and work.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rnmci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rnmci7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-15" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Ro6ci7d6:" popovertarget=":Ro6ci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Ro6ci7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/mastering-ai-workflows-with-fme-peak-of-data-ai-2025/280367935"><span class="sr-only">Mastering AI Workflows with FME - Peak of Data &amp; Seamlessly integrate a wide range of models, including those for data enhancement, forecasting, image and object recognition, and large language models. Customize AI models to meet your exact needs with FME’s powerful tools for training, optimization, and seamless integration</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Ro6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Ro6ci7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-16" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Romci7d6:" popovertarget=":Romci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Romci7d6"><a Resilience</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:16" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="Floods in Valencia: Two FME-Powered Stories of Data Resilience" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/floodsinvalenciafranciscogiron-franciscogirongesteira-250609174046-992f5f05-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Floods in Valencia: Two FME-Powered Stories of Data Resilience</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Floods in Valencia: Two FME-Powered Stories of Data Resilience for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5momci7d6:" popovertarget=":R5momci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5momci7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5momci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5momci7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/SafeSoftware">Safe Software</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">In October 2024, the Spanish region of Valencia faced severe flooding that underscored the critical need for accessible and actionable data. This presentation will explore two innovative use cases where FME facilitated data integration and availability during the crisis. The first case demonstrates how FME was used to process and convert satellite imagery and other geospatial data into formats tailored for rapid analysis by emergency teams. The second case delves into making human mobility data—collected from mobile phone signals—accessible as source-destination matrices, offering key insights into population movements during and after the flooding. These stories highlight how FME&#x27;s powerful capabilities can bridge the gap between raw data and decision-making, fostering resilience and preparedness in the face of natural disasters. Attendees will gain practical insights into how FME can support crisis management and urban planning in a changing climate.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Romci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Romci7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-17" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rp6ci7d6:" popovertarget=":Rp6ci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rp6ci7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:17" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/shepherdchristine518">Christine Shepherd</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">AI agents are reshaping logistics and supply chain operations by enabling automation, predictive insights, and real-time decision-making across key functions such as demand forecasting, inventory management, procurement, transportation, and warehouse operations. Powered by technologies like machine learning, NLP, computer vision, and robotic process automation, these agents deliver significant benefits including cost reduction, improved efficiency, greater visibility, and enhanced adaptability to market changes. While practical use cases show measurable gains in areas like dynamic routing and real-time inventory tracking, successful implementation requires careful integration with existing systems, quality data, and strategic scaling. Despite challenges such as data integration and change management, AI agents offer a strong competitive edge, with widespread industry adoption expected by 2025.</span></div></div><div class="" class="sr-only"></span></span>CrowdCasts Monthly: You Have an Adversary Problem</h2><div><ul class="Transcript_list__faItj"><div><li>1. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#1">You Have an
ADVERSARY </a> PROBLEM.
Who’s Targeting You and Why?

 </li></div><div><li>2. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#2">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

AGENDA

YOU </a> HAVE AN ADVERSARY PROBLEM.
1. 

INTELLIGENCE-DRIVEN SECURITY

2. 

ADVERSARY CATEGORIZATION

ADVERSARY GROUPS - OVERVIEW

4. 

NOTABLE ACTIVITY – Q3

5. 

NEW ACTORS

6. 

ACTIONALIZING INTELLIGENCE

 </li></div><div><li>3. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#3">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Today’s </a> Speakers
ADAM MEYERS |
VP, INTELLIGENCE
Recognized speaker, trainer, and intelligence expert with 15+ years
of cyber security industry experience
10 years in the DIB supporting US GOV customers on topics
ranging from wireless, pen testing, IR, and malware analysis

@ADAM_CYBER

2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

3

 </li></div><div><li>4. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#4">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Today’s </a> Speakers
MATT DAHL |
SENIOR ANALYST/ LEGAL COUNSEL
Cyber threat analyst focused on targeted intrusion activity
Focused on investigating indicators of compromise to identify
specific adversary activity
Legal liaison to the CrowdStrike Intelligence Team

@CROWDSTRIKE

2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

4

 </li></div><div><li>5. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#5">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Adversaries </a> are humans
Targeted Attackers:

WHO ARE THE
ADVERSARIES?

Motivation can range from disruption,
theft, to even destruction
They need to get in
They will likely need to move laterally

Spray and Pray (Prey):
They don’t care who they target
(sometimes what)
The more they compromise the
more they win
Motivation can range from disruption,
theft, to even destruction
2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

5

 </li></div><div><li>6. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#6">INTELLIGENCE-DRIVEN SECURITY

2013 CrowdStrike, </a> Inc. All rights reserved.

6

 </li></div><div><li>7. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#7">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Adversary </a> Categorization
CATEGORIZATION| Adversary Groups

1

Tactics, Techniques, and Practices

2

Never assume relationships exist
Between indicators

3

Recognize adversaries are constantly changing

4

But RECOGNIZE they are HUMAN

CATEGORIZATION

2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

7

 </li></div><div><li>8. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#8">Intelligence: Adversary Groups

@CROWDSTRIKE </a> | #CROWDCASTS

 </li></div><div><li>9. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#9">Intelligence

@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Adversary </a> Groups

IRAN

Companies

      // This script assumes the Osano script is synchronously loaded
      try {
        window.eventsToSend = window.eventsToSend || []
        if (window.Osano) {
          window.eventsToSend.push({
            name: "osano_loaded",
            timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
            value: JSON.stringify({
              time: performance?.now()
            })
          })
        }
      } catch (error) {
        console.error("Failed to push Osano event:", error)
      }

Who's Targeting You and Why? \r\n \r\nNation-States, Hacktivists, Industrial Spies, and Organized Criminal Groups are attacking your enterprise on a daily basis. Their goals range from espionage for technology advancement and disruption of critical infrastructure to for-profit theft of trade secrets and supporting a political agenda. You no longer have a malware problem, you have an adversary problem, and you must incorporate an intelligence-driven approach to your security strategy. \r\n \r\nDuring this CrowdCast, you will learn how to:\r\n\r\n    Incorporate Actionable Intelligence into your existing enterprise security infrastructure \r\n    Quickly understand the capabilities and artifacts of targeted attacked tradecraft \r\n    Gain insight into the motivations and intentions of targeted attackers\r\n    Make informed decisions based off of specific threat It is a profile of the type, composition, and capabilities of an adversary. DBT is the key input nuclear power plants use for the design of systems against acts of radiological sabotage and theft of special nuclear material. The NRC expects its licensees, nuclear power plants, to demonstrate that they can defend against the DBT. Currently, cyber is included in DBTs simply as a prescribed list of IT centric security controls. Using MITRE’s ATT\u0026CK framework, Cyber DBTs can be created that are specific to the facility, its material, or adversary activities.","tags":["mitre att\u0026ck","mitre attackcon power hour","mitre attack"],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/using-attack-to-create-cyber-dbts-for-nuclear-power-plants/241296785","userLogin":"attackcon2018","userName":"MITRE - ATT\u0026CKcon","viewCount":603},{"algorithmId":"5","displayTitle":"Purple Teaming with ATT\u0026CK - x33fcon 2018","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":25,"score":0.529128,"slideshowId":"96390174","sourceName":"cm_interact","strippedTitle":"purple-teaming-with-attck-x33fcon-2018","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/x33fconmitrepr-180508131610-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"Presentation slides presented by Cody Thomas and Christopher Korban at x33fcon 2018 about how to jumpstart your purple teaming with the MITRE ATT\u0026CK framework, and accompanying Adversary Emulation Plans","tags":["att\u0026ck","mitre","x33fcon"],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/purple-teaming-with-attck-x33fcon-2018/96390174","userLogin":"ChristopherKorban","userName":"Christopher Korban","viewCount":4489},{"algorithmId":"5","displayTitle":"ATT\u0026CK Updates- Defensive ATT\u0026CK","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":9,"score":0.528112,"slideshowId":"251521741","sourceName":"cm_interact","strippedTitle":"attck-updates-defensive-attck","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/attckupdates-defensiveattck-220406005546-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"Lex Crumpton leads MITRE's defensive ATT\u0026CK efforts.
